intro: Gymnanthes pachystachya, commonly known as the giant sycamore, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces a toxic latex sap that can cause skin irritation. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitats.
